item.title: What's on our Menu?
item.content: Rising to confectionary fame in 16th-century France, the macaron brings plenty of taste and tradition to the table. Continuing a successful collaboration between Laura Hale and Amy Shippy, owners of Maison de Macarons, their imagination and passion for cooking has created macarons not only pleasing to the eye but to the palate as well. Beginning with almonds they freshly grind each day and using only the finest ingredients in these meringue-based cookies, Laura and Amy are bringing a bit of France to the low country and beyond. With flavors like cappuccino, salted caramel, raspberry, chocolate, coconut, peanut butter, pistachio, and so many more, their macaron recipes have built a legacy of their own at this quaint Skidaway Road patisserie.

item.title: Macaron
item.description: The name of the cookie comes from an Italian word meaning paste, macaroon. While origins are uncertain, some culinary historians claim that macaroons can be traced to an Italian monastery.
